Deepstate reports that Russia carried out a series of mechanised assaults in the Orikhiv direction, western Zaporizhzhia Oblast, today.   They stated that Russian forces, using tanks, BMPs, BTRs, and infantry attacked on four assault vectors towards Mala Tokmachka‚Ä¶

Update: A Russian channel with connections on the frontline claims that Russian soldiers entered Novodanylivka (south of Orikhiv).
Keep in mind, all previous Russian attempts to gain a foothold in the village have failed, but this attack does seem to be much larger.
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
A secondary target has also been hit. 4 KABs impacted the power plant, and 4 others impacted something else. The KABs have been launched in two waves so far, 2 hitting each target at a time.
High threat of Iskander launches from Kursk
Iskander on Richky, Sumy Oblast
Two missiles were detected, both S-300 air defence missiles. No Iskander threat.
Three S-300 missiles (ground-to-ground) struck the Bilopillya area in Sumy Oblast
A Su-34 is flying to the launch lines in Kherson Oblast from Dzhankoi, Crimea. KAB launches to Ukrainian-controlled Kherson Oblast are expected in the next 15 minutes.
Three S-300 missiles (ground-to-ground) struck the Bilopillya area in Sumy Oblast
Bilopillya District continues to be shelled by S-300s. 2+ more impacts.
A Su-34 is flying to the launch lines in Kherson Oblast from Dzhankoi, Crimea. KAB launches to Ukrainian-controlled Kherson Oblast are expected in the next 15 minutes.
The combat mission was cancelled for some reason. 5 (!) Su-34s flew to the launch lines northwest of Chaplynka, Kherson Oblast, and made a return flight to Crimea.

Kherson City is currently under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones. At least four impacts have been recorded in the Tavriya District. 
1 reconnaissance drone is operating over the Dnipro River, opposite Korobelnyi Island.
The combat mission was cancelled for some reason. 5 (!) Su-34s flew to the launch lines northwest of Chaplynka, Kherson Oblast, and made a return flight to Crimea.
The 5 Su-34s flew something like this while the Gerans were striking Kherson. Very weird.
The 5 Su-34s flew something like this while the Gerans were striking Kherson. Very weird.
Also there were no Su-35 escorts for some reason.

Regarding the Geran-2 drone strikes on Kherson, here are some videos showing the impacts. Ukrainian air defence in the city attempted to shoot them down but was ineffective. The target was something in the Tavriya District, but I'm not sure exactly what. It doesn't seem to be energy-related.
More Gerans were launched from Hvardiiske Training Ground in Crimea earlier. They may also strike Kherson in the coming hours.

Regarding the Geran-2 drone strikes on Kherson, here are some videos showing the impacts. Ukrainian air defence in the city attempted to shoot them down but was ineffective. The target was something in the Tavriya District, but I'm not sure exactly what. It doesn't seem to be energy-related.
More Gerans were launched from Hvardiiske Training Ground in Crimea earlier. They may also strike Kherson in the coming hours.
Kharkiv city is currently under a large-scale attack from Russian KAB glide-bombs. At least five impacts so far. Reports state that they are targeting the TEC-5 Power Plant (49.97073, 36.10046).
Correction: Only one KAB targeted the power plant. 3-4 others hit something outside the city limits, while 3 more were shot down by air defence missiles.
Earlier, the Honcharivske Training Ground in Chernihiv Oblast was targeted by two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles. Now, at least 10 Geran-2 drones are flying in its direction.

Russia Keeps Up Strikes ‚Äî Kyiv Forced to Seek Billions for Gas
On October 19-20, Russian forces carried out a series of strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and transportation infrastructure. A key target was also the maritime oil terminal ‚ÄúYuzhny‚Äù in the Odesa region.
Due to the intensification of Russian strikes on gas infrastructure and extraction fields since the beginning of October, Ukraine intends to import significant volumes of gas to offset the resulting loss of domestic gas production.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky highlighted an urgent need for funding to purchase gas for the upcoming winter, estimating the requirement at $2 billion. He pointed to potential supplies from Greece, Slovakia, Azerbaijan, as well as agreements on liquefied natural gas (LNG) deliveries from the United States.
‚ÄúWe have found part of the funding: Norway [will provide] a $100 million grant and will allocate another tranche in January."
üëâ

US Deep State Attempt Color Revolution Just Before Trump Meets With Putin
The ‚ÄúNo Kings‚Äù protest shows that what has been happening for decades in other countries, specifically Washington-backed color revolutions financed through unaccountable money, has now boomeranged and reached the United States itself.¬†The No Kings protest was sponsored with so-called ‚Äúblack money‚Äù that is now practically legalized in politics in the United States, with George Soros, of course, among the leading people who financed it through his Open Society Foundations, but also with the funds of some other ultra-liberal or neo-conservative billionaires, with the aim of not only protesting US President Donald Trump‚Äôs domestic policies, but also to undermine his upcoming meeting with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.
Millions of Democrats, liberals, and some disillusioned Republicans across the US, especially in New York, California, Chicago, and Washington DC, attended the No Kings demonstrations...

ISIS-Linked Syrian Official Captured, Then Freed by U.S. Forces In New Scandal
The United States-led coalition captured a member of ISIS during a helicopter raid in the heart of Syria, only to release him later with mortal wounds after finding out that he recently became a local official working with the country‚Äôs new Islamists-led government.
The news of the capture of Ahmed Abdullah Al-Masoud al-Badri spread quickly on social media after the raid, which took place in the town of al-Dumayr, some 40 kilometers to the northeast of Damascus, on October 18.
The raid was reportedly carried out by U.S. special forces and the Syrian Free Army (SFA). The group announced it was merging into the new Syrian military shortly after the fall of the regime of former president Bashar al-Assad. However, it continues to operate in the area of al-Tanf under the direct command of the U.S.-led coalition.
Read more

Russian Army Shocks Kiev Forces With Attack On Mala Tokmachka (Videos)
Late on October 20, the Russian military‚Äôs Vostok [East] Group of Forces broke through Ukrainian defenses to the south of Mala Tokmachka in the Zaporozhye direction, and stormed the key settlement in a surprise attack.
The attack is reportedly being led by the 58th Guards Combined Arms Army. It began with a series of artillery and drone strikes on Ukrainian troops, equipment and positions in Mala Tokmachka.
Russian troops then advanced from Robotyne, Nesterianka, and Novopokrovka towards the settlement in large armored formations, including man battle tanks and infantry fighting vehicles, as well as in smaller, faster units moving on motorcycles.

New Version Of Russia‚Äôs UMPK Bomb Kit Makes First Appearance
On October 21, a photo showing a completely new version of Russia‚Äôs UMPK [Russian: –£–ú–ü–ö; –£–Ω–∏—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –º–æ–¥—É–ª—å –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏, Unified gliding and correction module] kit surfaced online.
Unlike the original UMPK kit which featured a basic design centered around a single piece with both the wings and control fins that can be clipped in on to any Soviet-era bomb weighing 500 kg or less, the new kit includes two separate wings and control fins sections specifically designed to fit into newer FAB-500-series bombs.

Another Mysterious Airstrip Appeared On Yemeni Island Close To Houthi Areas 
A 2,000-meter airstrip is being built on Zuqar Island in the Red Sea off the coast of Yemen, The Associated Press reported on October 20, citing satellite images from Planet Labs PBC.
Zuqar Island lies between the coasts of the Yemeni province of al-Hodeidah, which is controlled by the Houthis (Ansar Allah), and Eritrea, close to the Bab-el-Mandeb strait which connects the Red Sea to the Gulf of Aden.
